Education is a national and deeply social issue. Because it affects the way people learn to function within a society.
But it is also a means of controlling and criticizing citizens in power. Education is ultimately a matter of democracy.
When we took over the government, we were faced with the dismantling conditions that created extreme interventions in previous years.
Today we are building a new vision for education. We increased Education funding to 2.8%, increasing funding for Higher Education Institutions and TEIs
September 2016 is a milestone: They opened on time for the first time for many years schools across the country
With 2 years of serious planning and a front in microcomplications, the opening of schools on time was something that could be done.
With the abolition of the Management Boards, we restore democracy and the self-government of the Universities. This is an element of respect.
We innovate with a plan and set up Academic Councils for Higher Education and Research in each Country.
We build structures to help Universities, Technological Educational Institutes and Research Centers connect with each other and with the real needs of society.
The lies of the Colombian government on economic growth after the Santos-FARC agreement https://t.co/QEoDnoblde
We are not afraid of the student movement: We reintroduce asylum for the free presence of ideas, as long as they respect democratic freedoms.
We stop the high tuition factories in postgraduate studies, often defined in terms of purchase rather than at the cost of the postgraduate
No student admitted to a Master's degree will be excluded if he / she has a proven inability to pay the tuition fees.
For the first time we set terms for free attendance of those with academic qualifications but unable to pay the attendance fees.
The law is still satisfying the long-standing demand of polytechnic schools for a 5-year academic degree with a masters degree.
Linked to the upgrading of higher education is the process that has begun for the establishment of University of Western Attica.
We found Professional Lykeia in dismantling conditions. We, on the other hand, are upgrading them: The apprenticeship year is a reality anymore.
We plan in the next school year the 830 multigrade schools located in the outskirts of our country to set up an all-day
We are also installing with the help of the thousands of librarians themselves in the primary schools of our country.
